body:
### Description

Interested in this extension, please +1 via the emoji/reaction feature of GitHub (top right).

### Repository name

quarkus-dashbuilder

### Short description

Enable creation of dashboards using local and remote data with DashBuilder

### Repository Homepage URL

https://quarkiverse.github.io/quarkiverse-docs/quarkus-dashbuilder/dev/

### Repository Topics

- quarkus-extension
- dashbuilder
...


### Team Members

- @jesuino 


### GitHub Applications?

- [ ] [Stale](https://github.com/marketplace/stale) - Automatically close stale Issues and Pull Requests that tend to accumulate during a project

### Additional context

opening this after discussing with @jesuino ways to make it easy to integrate [dashbuilder](https://www.dashbuilder.org/).

He already made an awesome integration at https://github.com/jesuino/kie-tools/tree/KOGITO-8350/packages/dashbuilder-quarkus-extension which allows you to simply add the extension and it will serve out dashboard yaml on classpath under <app>/dashboards.

Its like a rich poor man grafana toolset easily embeddable into any quarkus app.

Here is a minimal jbang example showing how it works: https://gist.github.com/jesuino/91e55491a5bf393173b38f76d63b24b8 

It wont build unless you have the kie build setup for now thus here are some screenshots to illustrate what it enables:

![2022-12-21_09-03-08](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54129/208853168-10d28ec0-1b47-4c59-82ed-22270a167163.png)

![2022-12-21_09-03-16](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54129/208853179-52684e3e-c8ef-4722-9913-3d10759da73d.png)

![2022-12-21_09-03-35](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54129/208853190-192668e2-86e5-4312-879b-126fef7ad9c7.png)

![2022-12-21_09-09-13](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54129/208853201-791ae8d4-e878-4211-b758-e9fef4a7f77b.png)


NB. initially discussed to be in kie/kogito repo but decided to kick it off in quarkiverse first to see how it evolves as with this the repo is not tied to the release schedule of neither quarkus nor kie.
